00:01:26,700 --> 00:01:30,120
 اهدين الصراط المستقيم, guide us to the straight path.

21
00:01:30,120 --> 00:01:36,060
 So in other words, is that there is explicitly, according to the Fatiha, a path.

22
00:01:36,960 --> 00:01:42,340
 And then the amazing thing is, right after this, Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala connects us to the people of the path.

23
00:01:42,340 --> 00:01:47,740
 So we have the meaning of the path itself, and then the people that tread that path.

24
00:01:47,740 --> 00:01:50,300
 يَرَاطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْ أَمْتَعَ عَلِهِمْ

25
00:01:50,300 --> 00:01:56,100
 The path of those that you have bestowed your favor upon, further clarified in another verse,

26
00:01:56,100 --> 00:02:00,440
 that they are the prophets, the Siddiqeen, the martyrs, and the righteous.

27
00:02:00,440 --> 00:02:03,020
 And so that this is a path that exists.

28
00:02:03,020 --> 00:02:09,660
 We learn this from the prophets, and then there are people that have tread this path and have become successful in it.

29
00:02:09,660 --> 00:02:14,520
 And so I think that this is very clear, and there's multiple other verses that indicate this,

30
00:02:14,520 --> 00:02:15,680
 but this is a starting point.

31
00:02:15,680 --> 00:02:24,880
 Shaykh Ismail, you noticed Sharia here mentioned, not only is it a path, but it points to the people of the path.

32
00:02:24,880 --> 00:02:30,540
 Rather than saying the path of, could have said path of Islam, could have said the path of the Qur'an.

33
00:02:30,540 --> 00:02:35,000
 So what's the wisdom that it mentions the people of those paths?

34
00:02:35,000 --> 00:02:40,540
 بسم الله والحمد لله وصلى الله على سيدنا رسول الله وعلى آله وصحبه ومن ولا.

35
00:02:40,540 --> 00:02:44,580
 Yeah, our scholars, they say, العلم في الصدور لا في الصطور.

36
00:02:44,580 --> 00:02:49,620
 That knowledge is taken from the breasts, from the hearts of men, not just from books.

37
00:02:49,620 --> 00:02:52,400
 And Allah عز و جل says in the Qur'an al-Kareem,

38
00:02:52,400 --> 00:02:56,520
 إِنَّ أَوْلِيَاءَ اللَّهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ

39
00:02:56,520 --> 00:03:02,760
 One of my friends recently told me, subhanAllah, this is a sign that the awliya are always present.

40
00:03:03,420 --> 00:03:08,440
 They don't have fear, and they don't express, they don't experience sadness.

41
00:03:08,440 --> 00:03:10,060
 They're always with Allah عز و جل.

42
00:03:10,060 --> 00:03:12,600
 And the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم, he said,

43
00:03:12,600 --> 00:03:17,240
 أَوْلِيَاءَ اللَّهِ إِذَا رُؤُوا ذُكِرَ اللَّهِ

44
00:03:17,240 --> 00:03:18,960
 That this is the sign of a wali.

45
00:03:18,960 --> 00:03:23,340
 If you see someone, when you see them, you remember Allah عز و جل.

46
00:03:23,340 --> 00:03:25,880
 This could be a sign that this person is from the awliya.

47
00:03:26,640 --> 00:03:35,340
 Very good. Now, next question that's come to us is, all of this subject matter seems very directed to the individual.

48
00:03:35,340 --> 00:03:42,900
 So is there a harm then, in that case, that a person will become passive, removed from society, only focused on himself?

49
00:03:43,700 --> 00:03:51,900
 Or is it that this is a precondition or a prerequisite to doing any of the work that society needs and the ummah needs?

50
00:03:51,900 --> 00:03:57,820
 So that, I think that you could answer that by saying the verse that Sheikh Ismail quoted there.

51
00:03:57,820 --> 00:04:01,780
 If you continue, it says that Allah Ta'ala describes who they are.

52
00:04:01,780 --> 00:04:06,200
 لَا خُوفَنَ عَلَمُ لَهُمْ يَحْزُونَ أَلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَكَانُوا يَتَّقُونَ

53
00:04:06,200 --> 00:04:10,660
 They are the people who believe and are people of taqwa, are mindful of Allah.

54
00:04:10,660 --> 00:04:19,460
 And if you look at what taqwa is, it's to fulfill the commandments of Allah inwardly and outwardly and to avoid His prohibitions inwardly and outwardly.

55
00:04:19,460 --> 00:04:23,400
 And there is a little bit of nuance to this topic, of course.

56
00:04:23,580 --> 00:04:30,120
 But if you look at throughout the Qur'an, all of the guidance of the Qur'an, there definitely is a societal dimension.

57
00:04:30,120 --> 00:04:41,320
 Yes, the nuance is in that there might be certain times and certain situations that there are certain ahadith that indicate that you should focus on yourself and not be as involved in certain situations.

58
00:04:41,520 --> 00:04:47,460
 But short of that, the awliya of Allah are usually the most active in society.

59
00:04:47,460 --> 00:04:55,600
 And they have such an impact on society precisely because they are so detached and they do everything through their Lord, subhanahu wa ta'ala.

60
00:04:55,600 --> 00:04:57,980
 There is a spiritual path.

61
00:04:57,980 --> 00:05:00,880
 There is also an enemy who is also very spiritual.

62
00:05:00,880 --> 00:05:04,360
 Iblis, in a sense, is spiritual.

63
00:05:04,360 --> 00:05:06,700
 He is someone that we don't see.

64
00:05:07,380 --> 00:05:11,960
 The jinn are a force that is unseen to us and seems to be of the spirit realm.

65
00:05:11,960 --> 00:05:18,300
 So, as there is an angelic realm to spirituality, there is also a dark realm.

66
00:05:18,300 --> 00:05:20,200
 How does a person navigate between the two?

67
00:05:20,200 --> 00:05:25,900
 I think by being with teachers and connecting yourself with people who are connected to people,

68
00:05:25,900 --> 00:05:28,540
 who are connected to people back to the Prophet ﷺ,

69
00:05:28,540 --> 00:05:34,320
 you really need, you know, some type of murabbi, some type of teacher, some type of mentor.

70
00:05:34,640 --> 00:05:38,020
 And there is a famous saying that, they say in many different cultures,

71
00:05:38,020 --> 00:05:42,160
 that the person who doesn't have a shaykh, shaytan is his shaykh, you know.

72
00:05:42,160 --> 00:05:46,100
 And so, you want to be connected to teachers who have sanad.

73
00:05:46,100 --> 00:05:49,060
 Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak, he says famously,

74
00:05:49,060 --> 00:05:53,640
 as-sanadu min ad-deen, law-las-sanad, la-qaala man-sha'a ma-sha'a.

75
00:05:53,640 --> 00:05:57,380
 That a chain of narration, sanad, is from our religion.

76
00:05:57,380 --> 00:06:01,440
 If it wasn't for that, and if we didn't have that, anyone could say anything.

77
00:06:01,600 --> 00:06:05,580
 And this is where you get people who are influenced by the shaytan,

78
00:06:05,580 --> 00:06:11,080
 influenced by their nafs, and they begin to spew, you know, information that has no basis.

79
00:06:11,080 --> 00:06:17,640
 So, what we do is we connect ourselves to Ahlullah, right?

80
00:06:17,640 --> 00:06:19,700
 The Prophet ﷺ says,

81
00:06:19,700 --> 00:06:21,560
 Ahlul Qur'an hum Ahlullah.

82
00:06:21,560 --> 00:06:24,560
 That the people of the Qur'an are the people of Allah.

83
00:06:24,560 --> 00:06:34,160
 The people who have studied and sat with those who sat with those who sat with people that connect back to the Prophet ﷺ.

84
00:06:34,160 --> 00:06:36,580
 And this is a way to protect yourself.

85
00:06:36,580 --> 00:06:39,340
 This is a way to be a part of a community.

86
00:06:39,340 --> 00:06:46,860
 And especially, you know, we're encouraged to go to the masjid for the different prayers and for jumu'ah.

87
00:06:46,860 --> 00:06:51,000
 And there's a reason for that, to be with the community and with teachers and with brothers and sisters.

88
00:06:51,000 --> 00:06:52,680
 Masha'Allah.

89
00:06:52,680 --> 00:06:57,600
 Let me just add something to that, because I think that you brought something up very important there, Dr. Shadi,

90
00:06:57,600 --> 00:07:03,560
 in that when you said that there's a spiritual dimension to shaytan, meaning that he's in the unseen.

91
00:07:03,780 --> 00:07:09,200
 These are things that we don't witness, and one of our teachers said recently, which I thought was very profound.

92
00:07:09,200 --> 00:07:20,480
 Because of the materialistic world in which we live, people are searching deep within their being for something from the immaterial realm,

93
00:07:20,480 --> 00:07:22,880
 because we are made of spirit and clay.

94
00:07:22,880 --> 00:07:29,960
 But if you don't have a teacher, as Shikha Ismail mentioned, you're not protected from sifting through what happens in the unseen.

95
00:07:30,160 --> 00:07:37,920
 So people could misinterpret, because of how focused they are on, and how materialistic their perspective is,

96
00:07:37,920 --> 00:07:42,140
 thinking that everything that happens to them from the realm of the unseen is something that is good.

97
00:07:42,140 --> 00:07:46,200
 And this is certainly the case with much of the pseudo-spirituality that is out there,

98
00:07:46,200 --> 00:07:53,820
 is that you open up the floodgates if you don't have the protection of this synod, of this chain, of these correct teachings, of this correct approach.

99
00:07:53,820 --> 00:07:59,200
 Meaning that you could have what you think is a spiritual experience, but it's actually demonic.

100
00:07:59,200 --> 00:08:04,020
 And this is the importance of really having the correct path in this whole thing.

101
00:08:04,020 --> 00:08:05,700
 So I think that's a very important point to know.

102
00:08:05,700 --> 00:08:06,260
 That's critical.

103
00:08:06,260 --> 00:08:12,360
 And I was once talking to a very educated Hindu person, and I was saying,

104
00:08:12,520 --> 00:08:17,660
 explain to me how is it these people get so educated, yet they still go to the temple.

105
00:08:17,660 --> 00:08:24,580
 And he basically said, the gurus, they are spiritually in touch.

106
00:08:25,620 --> 00:08:28,080
 And for a while, I thought, this can't be.

107
00:08:28,080 --> 00:08:30,680
 But then afterwards realized, yeah, they are in touch.

108
00:08:30,680 --> 00:08:31,820
 They are in touch with shayaltine.

109
00:08:31,820 --> 00:08:34,320
 They're in touch with shayaltine al-jinn.

110
00:08:34,320 --> 00:08:36,900
 Not every spiritual experience is a good experience.

111
00:08:36,900 --> 00:08:40,880
 A spiritual experience has to be of the right kind, from the right source.

112
00:08:40,880 --> 00:08:45,080
 So yeah, they are getting spirituality, but it's a dark spirituality.

113
00:08:46,500 --> 00:08:48,920
 And now let's ask this question.

114
00:08:48,920 --> 00:08:50,400
 I'm a simple person.

115
00:08:50,400 --> 00:08:56,300
 I'm watching this Ramadan series, fasting and working like every other person out there.

116
00:08:56,300 --> 00:09:03,140
 What is the number one fastest route on this path that we're calling there,

117
00:09:03,140 --> 00:09:07,440
 or that we're talking about in this series, the path of wilayah?

118
00:09:07,440 --> 00:09:11,760
 Wilayah being divine protection, nearness to Allah.

119
00:09:11,760 --> 00:09:14,620
 This is the goal of every Muslim.

120
00:09:15,180 --> 00:09:16,780
 So I'm a working man.

121
00:09:16,780 --> 00:09:22,360
 I'm a busy person, or a mother with children who's working and taking care of kids.

122
00:09:22,360 --> 00:09:26,600
 Give me something very simple to latch on to, that's easy, practical,

123
00:09:26,600 --> 00:09:31,200
 that will be my rope along this path.

124
00:09:31,200 --> 00:09:34,740
 I would say it's actually very easy.

125
00:09:34,740 --> 00:09:35,900
 One, intention.

126
00:09:35,900 --> 00:09:40,560
 Reframe your whole life so that everything that you do is for the sake of Allah.

127
00:09:40,560 --> 00:09:42,860
 And have an intention behind everything that you do.

128
00:09:43,300 --> 00:09:48,120
 Two, in addition to the basics of the things you know you have to do, the five daily prayers, the fasting,

129
00:09:48,120 --> 00:09:53,620
 in addition to the basics, cultivate in your heart a love of the remembrance of Allah.

130
00:09:54,580 --> 00:09:56,480
 And then three, love.

131
00:09:56,480 --> 00:10:06,200
 If you can combine intention with extra devotional remembrance of Allah, and then love of Allah, and the love for the sake of Allah,

132
00:10:06,200 --> 00:10:09,580
 the doors will certainly open up in a very short period of time, inshaAllah.

133
00:10:10,800 --> 00:10:12,460
 Shaykh Ismail, you mentioned,

134
00:10:12,460 --> 00:10:17,960
 Allah described his path by people.

135
00:10:17,960 --> 00:10:23,400
 A lot of people out there, especially in the middle of America,

136
00:10:23,400 --> 00:10:30,020
 where maybe Shi'ukh don't live, or maybe parts of England, or wherever our viewers are,

137
00:10:30,020 --> 00:10:31,520
 don't have Shi'ukh.

138
00:10:31,520 --> 00:10:32,740
 They don't have access to Shi'ukh.

139
00:10:33,900 --> 00:10:34,920
 What's a replacement?

140
00:10:34,920 --> 00:10:36,820
 How do people make up for that?

141
00:10:36,820 --> 00:10:39,340
 Well, I was actually in that situation.

142
00:10:39,340 --> 00:10:43,220
 You know, when I was in college, I was in Johnson City, Tennessee.

143
00:10:43,220 --> 00:10:47,160
 And there was a masjid, but there was no imam, there was no shaykh, there was no teacher.

144
00:10:47,860 --> 00:10:55,160
 So, what I did was I tried to connect with Shi'ukh and teachers that were visiting in the surrounding areas,

145
00:10:55,160 --> 00:10:57,960
 or to take some time to attend programs.

146
00:10:57,960 --> 00:11:02,500
 You know, and one of those teachers, Shaykh Yahya, mashallah, he came and he visited my hometown.

147
00:11:02,500 --> 00:11:05,460
 So, I went home for the summer, and I attended.

148
00:11:05,460 --> 00:11:12,580
 And so, you have Shi'ukh, and you have teachers who have an authentic sanat, right?

149
00:11:12,580 --> 00:11:17,140
 And they have real training in the sharia around you.

150
00:11:17,140 --> 00:11:23,560
 Actually, if you think about it, and you look up, you know, all of the opportunities and resources now here in the U.S.,

151
00:11:23,560 --> 00:11:31,220
 whether they're in masajid, or institutes that have developed recently, there are a lot of opportunities.

152
00:11:31,220 --> 00:11:35,420
 You just have to make the intention, and you just have to sacrifice a little bit of time.

153
00:11:36,060 --> 00:11:43,940
 And, you know, as Shaykh Yahya mentioned, if you have a good intention, Allah Azza wa Jal will facilitate.

154
00:11:43,940 --> 00:11:47,480
 And Allah will send people, and Allah will facilitate programs.

155
00:11:47,480 --> 00:11:50,740
 It's really just between you and Allah, and Allah knows your heart.

156
00:11:50,740 --> 00:11:56,260
 And so, people take time to go on vacation, right?

157
00:11:56,260 --> 00:11:59,080
 People take time off to do many different things.

158
00:11:59,240 --> 00:12:06,140
 If you take time off and sacrifice for the sake of your deen, a relationship with Allah Azza wa Jal,

159
00:12:06,140 --> 00:12:10,040
 like Allah says in Al-Quran Al-Kareem,

160
00:12:10,040 --> 00:12:13,560
 وَالَّذِينَ جَاهَدُوا فِينا لَنَهْدِيَنَّهُمْ سُبُلَنَا

161
00:12:13,560 --> 00:12:16,840
 Those who struggle in our way, Allah will guide them.

162
00:12:16,840 --> 00:12:18,980
 So, it begins within.

163
00:12:18,980 --> 00:12:25,060
 If Allah sees that pure intention, He'll facilitate, but just keep going, you know.

164
00:12:25,740 --> 00:12:28,640
 All right, our last question for the segment.

165
00:12:28,640 --> 00:12:33,760
 If this is a path, there's progress and there's regress.

166
00:12:33,760 --> 00:12:36,860
 What are the signs of progress?

167
00:12:36,860 --> 00:12:39,700
 That's a question I'd like to ask both of you.

168
00:12:39,700 --> 00:12:41,720
 There are many signs, I think.

169
00:12:41,720 --> 00:12:49,380
 Succinctly, one of the signs is that you find istiqamah, which is uprightness, is facilitated for you.

170
00:12:50,480 --> 00:12:56,460
 And there could be short-term signs, like your heart expands, you start to taste the sweetness of worship.

171
00:12:56,460 --> 00:13:02,360
 But then that might be taken from you, and people oftentimes misinterpret what that means.

172
00:13:02,360 --> 00:13:05,700
 And they think that somehow they've been derailed, something happened to them,

173
00:13:05,740 --> 00:13:14,380
 and they're chasing this kind of early experience that they received when they first started setting out on the path to Allah Sopranathana.

174
00:13:14,380 --> 00:13:21,060
 So, I would say that the greatest sign really is a life of uprightness is facilitated for you.

175
00:13:21,060 --> 00:13:25,240
 And one of the things we have to recognize with the spiritual path, it's not linear.

176
00:13:26,080 --> 00:13:29,700
 It's not like reading a book from page 1 to page 150.

177
00:13:29,700 --> 00:13:32,040
 The spiritual path is not linear.

178
00:13:32,040 --> 00:13:34,840
 It's linear inwardly, but not outwardly.

179
00:13:34,840 --> 00:13:37,300
 There will be all types of things that come your way.

180
00:13:37,300 --> 00:13:40,700
 Our job is to respond to them with our servitude to Allah Sopranathana.

181
00:13:40,960 --> 00:13:49,200
 And you will get what you need in reality, but it's not going to necessarily be in the way that you think it's going to be,

182
00:13:49,200 --> 00:13:52,540
 or how you feel internally when things are happening.

183
00:13:52,540 --> 00:13:59,060
 Meaning, you might go through a major tribulation, and that's what you needed to reach the highest degrees, closest to Allah Sopranathana.

184
00:13:59,060 --> 00:14:05,440
 And the last thing I'll say is, is that spiritual growth also, like learning a language or anything else,

185
00:14:05,440 --> 00:14:08,500
 you will have your points where you plateau.

186
00:14:08,500 --> 00:14:13,680
 So, you kind of notice that you're increasing, but then it flattens out.

187
00:14:13,680 --> 00:14:18,560
 And then, the key is that when it flattens out, and you don't think that you're changing,

188
00:14:18,560 --> 00:14:23,800
 you keep exerting that spiritual struggle that Sheikh Ismail just referred to from that verse.

189
00:14:24,140 --> 00:14:27,320
 And then, what you'll find is, then you'll just like seem to like jump up.

190
00:14:27,320 --> 00:14:32,720
 So, like from like 30 to all of a sudden like 70% in that period of time.

191
00:14:32,720 --> 00:14:39,280
 But it requires that you keep putting that energy in to have that second increase after that ascension.

192
00:14:39,280 --> 00:14:40,780
 MashaAllah, yes.

193
00:14:40,780 --> 00:14:50,180
 And I'll add, you know, a sign of you progressing on that path is that you follow the sunnah of the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam

194
00:14:50,180 --> 00:14:53,300
 more and more in the right way, in the true way.

195
00:14:53,840 --> 00:15:01,120
 Meaning, if you become more religious, more spiritual, let's say, more obedient to Allah Azawajal,

196
00:15:01,120 --> 00:15:06,720
 but you're more judgmental, but you're not smiling as much anymore,

197
00:15:06,720 --> 00:15:13,600
 but you're breaking people's hearts, you know, through your tongue, through your actions,

198
00:15:13,600 --> 00:15:21,100
 and you're not becoming more merciful, you're not becoming tougher with yourself, but easier with others,

199
00:15:21,100 --> 00:15:23,100
 then that's a major red flag.

200
00:15:23,540 --> 00:15:31,380
 And you find, all of us know, when we sat with our teachers, the very first hadith we study and we hear,

201
00:15:31,380 --> 00:15:39,660
 is, like the first hadith we study with our teachers of hadith is that the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said,

202
00:15:39,660 --> 00:15:43,620
 those who are merciful with others will be shown mercy by the most merciful.

203
00:15:43,620 --> 00:15:51,840
 So if you become more religious, but you're less merciful, more judgmental, you know, always walking around with a frown,

204
00:15:52,220 --> 00:15:54,500
 then you're not truly following the Sunnah of the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam.

205
00:15:54,500 --> 00:16:02,060
 That's why it's so important to connect yourself with real teachers, and to also study the Seerah of the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam,

206
00:16:02,060 --> 00:16:05,700
 because how will you know if you're on the right path or not?

207
00:16:05,700 --> 00:16:09,740
 You know, how will you know if you're following the right person or not?

208
00:16:09,740 --> 00:16:13,100
 Or you're just following the ego or what you think religiosity is?

209
00:16:13,100 --> 00:16:14,280
 Masha'Allah.

210
00:16:14,280 --> 00:16:16,100
 JazakumAllahu khairan.

211
00:16:16,100 --> 00:16:17,460
 Subhanakallahumma bihamdik.

212
00:16:17,460 --> 00:16:19,660
 Nashhadu an la ilaha illa anta.

213
00:16:19,660 --> 00:16:21,320
 Nastaaghfiruk wa natubu alayk.

214
00:16:21,320 --> 00:16:22,420
 And we'll see you tomorrow.

215
00:16:22,420 --> 00:16:23,840
 Assalamualaikum warahmatullahi wabarakatuh.

 If you like these videos, you can catch more of them at Safina Society's YouTube channel,

 and you can study with us online at arcview.org.
